title: Kylie Jenner and Tyga post matching selfies - and 'throw shade' at Travis Scott
text:
The video will start in 8 Cancel

Get the biggest celebs stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

Kylie Jenner and her ex Tyga sparked a frenzy after posting matching Instagram pictures - minutes apart.

Fans have been keeping a close eye on the former couple after Kylie split with her boyfriend Travis Scott last month.

The lip kit mogul has already been forced to deny she'd reignited her romance with Tyga after she was spotted heading to his recording studio at 2am last week.

The pair were then seen together again at West Hollywood club Hyde Lounge on Saturday.

(Image: Instagram)

(Image: Instagram)

Following their recent run-ins, a newly single Kylie took to Instagram to post a snap of her posing outside her new $3 million Bugatti Chiron.

Sporting her hair in a chic cropped style, Kylie showed off her famous figure in a curve hugging double denim ensemble.

(Image: Instagram)

Kylie's attention-grabbing post came less than an hour after her ex Tyga posted a very similar snap of him standing beside a red Ferrari.

Eagled-eyed fans instantly clocked that Tyga, 29, was sporting a pair of Air Jordans designed by Kylie's ex Travis, which many took to be a deliberate dig.

"The shade!" cried one fan.

"Those sneakers though!" laughed another.

(Image: DPA/PA Images)

(Image: Getty Images)

The posts come just two days after Tyga drove his red Ferrari to Hollywood hotspot Hyde Lounge where Kylie was at with her pals.

Tyga was pictured arriving with his friend Alexander Edwards - who is Amber Rose's boyfriend.

While Kylie tried to shield behind her bodyguard as she made her entrance with her girls at around 1am.

(Image: Kylie Jenner/Instagram)

Days before Kylie took to Twitter to address rumours linking her to Tyga after she was spotted heading to his recording studio in the early hours.

The Kylie Cosmetics owner wrote: "The internet makes everything 100 times more dramatic than what it really is. There was no "2am date with Tyga". You see me drop two of my friends off at a studio that he happened to be at."
description: Eagle-eyed fans claimed Tyga was making a not so subtle dig at Kylie Jenner's ex boyfriend
